title: Google\Cloud\GkeMultiCloud\V1\AzureControlPlane
name: AzureControlPlane
description:
AzureControlPlane represents the control plane configurations.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.gkemulticloud.v1.AzureControlPlane

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.version
params.description: Required. The Kubernetes version to run on control plane replicas (e.g. 1.19.10-gke.1000). You can list all supported versions on a given Google Cloud region by calling [GetAzureServerConfig][google.cloud.gkemulticloud.v1.AzureClusters.GetAzureServerConfig].

params.name: data.subnet_id
params.description: Optional. The ARM ID of the default subnet for the control plane. The control plane VMs are deployed in this subnet, unless AzureControlPlane.replica_placements is specified. This subnet will also be used as default for AzureControlPlane.endpoint_subnet_id if AzureControlPlane.endpoint_subnet_id is not specified. Similarly it will be used as default for AzureClusterNetworking.service_load_balancer_subnet_id. Example: /subscriptions/<subscription-id>/resourceGroups/<resource-group-id>/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/<vnet-id>/subnets/default.

params.name: data.vm_size
params.description: Optional. The Azure VM size name. Example: Standard_DS2_v2. For available VM sizes, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/vm-naming-conventions. When unspecified, it defaults to Standard_DS2_v2.

params.name: data.ssh_config
params.description: Required. SSH configuration for how to access the underlying control plane machines.

params.name: data.root_volume
params.description: Optional. Configuration related to the root volume provisioned for each control plane replica. When unspecified, it defaults to 32-GiB Azure Disk.

params.name: data.main_volume
params.description: Optional. Configuration related to the main volume provisioned for each control plane replica. The main volume is in charge of storing all of the cluster's etcd state. When unspecified, it defaults to a 8-GiB Azure Disk.

params.name: data.database_encryption
params.description: Optional. Configuration related to application-layer secrets encryption.

params.name: data.proxy_config
params.description: Optional. Proxy configuration for outbound HTTP(S) traffic.

params.name: data.config_encryption
params.description: Optional. Configuration related to vm config encryption.

params.name: data.tags
params.description: Optional. A set of tags to apply to all underlying control plane Azure resources.

params.name: data.replica_placements
params.description: Optional. Configuration for where to place the control plane replicas. Up to three replica placement instances can be specified. If replica_placements is set, the replica placement instances will be applied to the three control plane replicas as evenly as possible.

params.name: data.endpoint_subnet_id
params.description: Optional. The ARM ID of the subnet where the control plane load balancer is deployed. When unspecified, it defaults to AzureControlPlane.subnet_id. Example: "/subscriptions/d00494d6-6f3c-4280-bbb2-899e163d1d30/resourceGroups/anthos_cluster_gkeust4/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/gke-vnet-gkeust4/subnets/subnetid123"

methods.name: getVersion
methods.description:
Required. The Kubernetes version to run on control plane replicas (e.g. 1.19.10-gke.1000).

You can list all supported versions on a given Google Cloud region by calling [GetAzureServerConfig][google.cloud.gkemulticloud.v1.AzureClusters.GetAzureServerConfig].

Generated from protobuf field string version = 1 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = REQUIRED];

methods.name: getSubnetId
methods.description:
Optional. The ARM ID of the default subnet for the control plane. The control plane VMs are deployed in this subnet, unless AzureControlPlane.replica_placements is specified. This subnet will also be used as default for AzureControlPlane.endpoint_subnet_id if AzureControlPlane.endpoint_subnet_id is not specified. Similarly it will be used as default for AzureClusterNetworking.service_load_balancer_subnet_id.

Example: /subscriptions/<subscription-id>/resourceGroups/<resource-group-id>/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/<vnet-id>/subnets/default.

Generated from protobuf field string subnet_id = 2 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

Example: /subscriptions/<subscription-id>/resourceGroups/<resource-group-id>/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/<vnet-id>/subnets/default.
